paper_title.ja: 行動療法と短期時間精神療法を組み症状を改善し得た不安神経症患者の事後経過-不安の精神病理-(共著)
paper_title.en: Longitudinal Study and Psychopathology of an Anxiety Neurosis Patient who Responded to a Combined Approach of Behavior Therapy and Brief Psychotherapy

description.ja: 不安神経症患者に, 系統的脱感作法による行動療法を実施した.患者との信頼関係の形成に, 行動療法3カ月前から短時間精神療法を導入し, 延べ30回の面接を行動療法と平行して行った.不安の性質をSTAIで, 不安の程度をMASで評価した.行動療法により行動範囲は拡大したが, 不安度は減少せず, むしろ行動療法終了5年後, 不安度は減少した.不安の軽減は, 短時間精神療法により患者内に主体的な不安解除の操作が習慣化したためと思われた.不安神経症患者に行動療法を実施する際には, 短時間精神療法を併用すると効果的と思われる.本症例の不安発生は未熟な自我に起因し, 短時間精神療法による自我(ego)への働きかけが不安の解除に関与したと思われた.
description.en: It is known that psychosomatic therapy is effective for anxiety neurosis in addition to drug therapy. In this study, we tried behavior therapy for a patient diagnosed as generalized anxiety disorder by DSM-III-R. The patient was a 25-year-old woman when she was first referred to the hospital in 1970,and diagnosed as anxiety neurosis. Although she was admitted to the hospital 9 times since then, she had not improved remarkably only by medication until we started to try behavior therapy in 1990. She could not go out alone and could not arrive at hospital without being accompanied by her mother because of her severe anxiety. We, therefore, tried systematic desensitization, whcih is one of the behavior therapy methods for 5 months without changing drugs. Brief psychotherapy was also started 3 months before behavior therapy to get a good reliable relationship between the patient and therapist. State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) was conducted to the patient just before the behavior therapy to find nature of her anxiety. The result of STAI showed that the patient had always unstable mind and high sensitivity, and when she ought to do some task, such as going out alone, her anxiety was increased more than necessary. To find the degree of her anxiety, Manifest Anxiety Scale (MAS) test was done to the patient every about 4 weeks during behavior therapy and also 5 years after finishing the therapy. After behavior therapy was started, scores of the MAS test were increased to a high level during 9th to 17th weeks, and decreased after 21st weeks. Five years after finishing behavior therapy, the patient was revalued. Although only medication had been given to the patient for 5 years, she looked fine and the score of the MAS test was the lowest of all the entire MAS experiments. Anxiety level remained decreasing even in 5 years after finishing behavior therapy.She was improved to go to hospital alone or go shopping alone in the neighborhood when behavior therapy was finished. Although the patient's behavior inhibition could be relieved by behavior therapy, her anxiety was not influenced by it alone. In this case, we concluded that behavior therapy was effective to relieve behavior inhibition, and brief psychotherapy was effective to reduce anxiety. We want to emphaaasize that brief psychotherapy is necessary to get better results in behavior therapy for anxiety neuroric patients, and is also important to get a good working rlationship between patient and therapist.In this case, we noticed that the patient's anxiety was attributed to her immature personality whcih is due to excessive by intimate relationship with her mother. We tried to establish her ego by brief psychotherapy, and this approach was thought to reduce her anxiety.

publisher.ja: 一般社団法人 日本心身医学会

paper_title.ja: 視覚刺激の中の情報-視知覚研究への前書-

paper_title.en: Longitudinal Study and Psychopathology of An Anxiety Neurosis Patient who Responded to a Combined approach of Behavior Therapy and Brief Psychotherapy(Jointly authored)

description.ja: 不安神経症患者に, 系統的脱感作法による行動療法を実施した.患者との信頼関係の形成に, 行動療法3カ月前から短時間精神療法を導入し, 延べ30回の面接を行動療法と平行して行った.不安の性質をSTAIで, 不安の程度をMASで評価した.行動療法により行動範囲は拡大したが, 不安度は減少せず, むしろ行動療法終了5年後, 不安度は減少した.不安の軽減は, 短時間精神療法により患者内に主体的な不安解除の操作が習慣化したためと思われた.不安神経症患者に行動療法を実施する際には, 短時間精神療法を併用すると効果的と思われる.本症例の不安発生は未熟な自我に起因し, 短時間精神療法による自我(ego)への働きかけが不安の解除に関与したと思われた.
description.en: It is known that psychosomatic therapy is effective for anxiety neurosis in addition to drug therapy. In this study, we tried behavior therapy for a patient diagnosed as generalized anxiety disorder by DSM-III-R. The patient was a 25-year-old woman when she was first referred to the hospital in 1970,and diagnosed as anxiety neurosis. Although she was admitted to the hospital 9 times since then, she had not improved remarkably only by medication until we started to try behavior therapy in 1990. She could not go out alone and could not arrive at hospital without being accompanied by her mother because of her severe anxiety. We, therefore, tried systematic desensitization, whcih is one of the behavior therapy methods for 5 months without changing drugs. Brief psychotherapy was also started 3 months before behavior therapy to get a good reliable relationship between the patient and therapist. State-Trait Anxiety Inventory (STAI) was conducted to the patient just before the behavior therapy to find nature of her anxiety. The result of STAI showed that the patient had always unstable mind and high sensitivity, and when she ought to do some task, such as going out alone, her anxiety was increased more than necessary. To find the degree of her anxiety, Manifest Anxiety Scale (MAS) test was done to the patient every about 4 weeks during behavior therapy and also 5 years after finishing the therapy. After behavior therapy was started, scores of the MAS test were increased to a high level during 9th to 17th weeks, and decreased after 21st weeks. Five years after finishing behavior therapy, the patient was revalued. Although only medication had been given to the patient for 5 years, she looked fine and the score of the MAS test was the lowest of all the entire MAS experiments. Anxiety level remained decreasing even in 5 years after finishing behavior therapy.She was improved to go to hospital alone or go shopping alone in the neighborhood when behavior therapy was finished. Although the patient's behavior inhibition could be relieved by behavior therapy, her anxiety was not influenced by it alone. In this case, we concluded that behavior therapy was effective to relieve behavior inhibition, and brief psychotherapy was effective to reduce anxiety. We want to emphaaasize that brief psychotherapy is necessary to get better results in behavior therapy for anxiety neuroric patients, and is also important to get a good working rlationship between patient and therapist.In this case, we noticed that the patient's anxiety was attributed to her immature personality whcih is due to excessive by intimate relationship with her mother. We tried to establish her ego by brief psychotherapy, and this approach was thought to reduce her anxiety.
